required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Routine Follow-up Coronary Angiography After Percutaneous Coronary Intervention Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Evaluation of Routine Follow-up Coronary Angiography After Percutaneous Coronary Intervention Trial
clinical_study.source: Kyoto University, Graduate School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the long term clinical impact of routine follow-up coronary angiography after percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI). The primary endpoint is a composite of death/myocardial infarction/stroke/emergency hospitalization for acute coronary syndrome/hospitalization for congestive heart failure at 3-year after percutaneous coronary intervention.

detailed_description.textblock: Routine follow-up coronary angiography after percutaneous coronary intervention has been performed to detect restenosis in a lot of PCI centers in Japan. On the other hand, previous studies reported that routine follow-up coronary angiography might lead to unnecessary reinterventions in asymptomatic patients. In this situation, the effect of routine follow-up coronary angiography on long-term clinical outcomes remains unknown. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the long-term clinical impact of routine follow-up coronary angiography after PCI compared with clinical follow-up alone. The primary endpoint of this study is a composite of death/myocardial infarction/stroke/emergency hospitalization for acute coronary syndrome/hospitalization for congestive heart failure at three-year after percutaneous coronary intervention. The design of this study is almost all-comer design enrolling patients received PCI without any exclusion criteria.

primary_outcome.measure: a composite of death/myocardial infarction/stroke/emergency hospitalization for acute coronary syndrome/hospitalization for congestive heart failure
primary_outcome.description: a composite of death/myocardial infarction/stroke/emergency hospitalization for acute coronary syndrome/hospitalization for congestive heart failure

secondary_outcome.description: stent thrombosis defined bya Academic Reseach Consortium
both ischemic and hemorrhagic stroke excluding transient ischemic attach
bleeding complications defined by GUSTO and TIMI

secondary_outcome.measure: emergency hospitalization for acute coronary syndrome
secondary_outcome.description: emergency hospitalization for acute coronary syndrome

secondary_outcome.measure: composite of cardiac death, myocardial infarction or acute coronary syndrome
secondary_outcome.description: composite of cardiac death, myocardial infarction or acute coronary syndrome
presence of clinically-driven follow-up coronary angiography

arm_group.description: routine follow-up coronary angiography at 8-12 after discharge for percutaneous coronary intervention
no routine follow-up coronary angiography at 8-12 after discharge for percutaneous coronary intervention

intervention.description: follow-up coronary angiography at 8-12 months after discharge for percutaneous coronary intervention
no routine follow-up coronary angiography at 8-12 months after discharge for percutaneous coronary intervention

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients received percutaneous coronary intervention
- Patients older than 20 years old
- Patients who will not scheduled any staged percutaneous coronary intervention

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Cardiovascular Medicine, Kyoto University Graduate School of Medicine

facility.name: Division of Cardiology, Kyoto University Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Kyoto University, Graduate School of Medicine
